00031 Molecule::~Molecule() {
00032 
00033     vector < Segment* > ::iterator segit;
00034     for (segit = this->Segments().begin();
00035             segit < this->Segments().end();
00036             segit ++) {
00037         delete *segit;
00038     }
00039     _segments.clear();
00040     _fragments.clear();
00041     _atoms.clear();
00042     
00043 }
00044 
00046 const int &Molecule::getId() {
00047         return _id;
00048 }
00049 
00051 const string &Molecule::getName() {
00052         return _name;
00053 }
00054 
00055 void Molecule::AddSegment( Segment* segment ) {
00056     _segments.push_back( segment );
00057     segment->setMolecule(this);
00058 }
00059 
00060 void Molecule::AddFragment(Fragment* fragment ) {
00061     _fragments.push_back( fragment );
00062     fragment->setMolecule(this);
00063 }
00064 
00065 void Molecule::AddAtom(Atom *atom ) {
00066     _atoms.push_back(atom);
00067     atom->setMolecule(this);
00068 }

00091 void Molecule::ReadXYZ(string filename)
00092 {
00093     ifstream in;
00094     double x,y,z;
00095     int natoms, id;
00096     string label, type;
00097     vec pos;
00098     
00099     cout << " Reading molecular coordinates from " << filename << endl;
00100     in.open(filename.c_str(), ios::in );
00101     if ( !in ) throw runtime_error( string("Error reading coordinates from: ") 
00102                                         + filename); 
00103     
00104     id = 1;
00105     while ( in.good() ) { // keep reading until end-of-file
00106         in >> type;
00107         in >> x;
00108         in >> y;
00109         in >> z;
00110         if( in.eof() ) break;
00111         //cout << type << ":" << x << ":" << y << ":" << z << endl;
00112         
00113         // creating atoms and adding them to the molecule
00114         //Atom *pAtom = new Atom( this, id++, type, 1, 0.12, 0.12);
00115         //vec position(x,y,z);
00116         //pAtom->setPos( position );                       
00117         //AddAtom( pAtom );  
00118 
00119     }      
00120     in.close();        
00121 }

00124 void Molecule::WritePDB( FILE *out ) {
00125     // out.setf(ios::fixed);
00126     
00127     vector < Atom* > :: iterator atom;
00128     for (atom = _atoms.begin(); atom < _atoms.end(); ++atom){
00129          int id = (*atom)->getId();      
00130          string name =  (*atom)->getName();
00131          string resname = (*atom)->getResname();
00132          int resnr = (*atom)->getResnr();
00133          vec position = (*atom)->getPos();  
00134          
00135          fprintf(out, "ATOM  %5d %4s%1s%3s %1s%4d%1s   %8.3f%8.3f%8.3f%6.2f%6.2f      %4s%2s%2s\n",
00136                  id,                    // Atom serial number           %5d 
00137                  name.c_str(),          // Atom name                    %4s
00138                  " ",                   // alternate location indicator.%1s
00139                  resname.c_str(),       // Residue name.                %3s
00140                  "A",                   // Chain identifier             %1s
00141                  resnr,                 // Residue sequence number      %4d
00142                  " ",                   // Insertion of residues.       %1s
00143                  position.getX()*10,    // X in Angstroms               %8.3f
00144                  position.getY()*10,    // Y in Angstroms               %8.3f
00145                  position.getZ()*10,    // Z in Angstroms               %8.3f
00146                  1.0,                   // Occupancy                    %6.2f
00147                  0.0,                   // Temperature factor           %6.2f
00148                  " ",                   // Segment identifier           %4s
00149                  name.c_str(),          // Element symbol               %2s
00150                  " "                    // Charge on the atom.          %2s
00151                  );
00152          
00153     }  
00154 }
00155 
00156 /*
00157          1         2         3         4         5         6         7         8
00158 12345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234567890
00159 ATOM   4150  H   ALA A 431       8.674  16.036  12.858  1.00  0.00           H
00160 
00161  1 -  6        Record name     "ATOM  "                                            
00162  7 - 11        Integer         Atom serial number.                   
00163 13 - 16        Atom            Atom name.                            
00164 17             Character       Alternate location indicator.         
00165 18 - 20        Residue name    Residue name.                         
00166 22             Character       Chain identifier.                     
00167 23 - 26        Integer         Residue sequence number.              
00168 27             AChar           Code for insertion of residues.       
00169 31 - 38        Real(8.3)       Orthogonal coordinates for X in Angstroms.                       
00170 39 - 46        Real(8.3)       Orthogonal coordinates for Y in Angstroms.                            
00171 47 - 54        Real(8.3)       Orthogonal coordinates for Z in Angstroms.                            
00172 55 - 60        Real(6.2)       Occupancy.                            
00173 61 - 66        Real(6.2)       Temperature factor (Default = 0.0).                   
00174 73 - 76        LString(4)      Segment identifier, left-justified.   
00175 77 - 78        LString(2)      Element symbol, right-justified.      
00176 79 - 80        LString(2)      Charge on the atom.       
00177 */
